message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $950,000. It's a valuable asset that could be worth even more to you.  I believe this is a fair price for both of us.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $850,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, but $850,000 is just a bit too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $900,000. This price still gives you a good value, and it allows me to get a reasonable return on my investment. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $900,000, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $875,000. This is the maximum I can afford for this product.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $875,000 is still a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers at $887,500. This is a fair price that allows both of us to reach a mutually beneficial agreement. What do you say?

I'm not willing to go above $875,000, so I'll stick with that offer. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I'm not budging from $875,000. If you're not willing to accept that, I'll have to explore other options.
